subject: Re: [junit] Is there an easier way to  add TestSuites of  classes from package?
msgSnippet: GSBase provides one implementation called RecursiveTestSuite. http://gsbase.sourceforge.net. ... J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s
messageBody:
GSBase provides one implementation called RecursiveTestSuite. http://gsbase.sourceforge.net

>So said Nelson on 2003-06-21 --------------------
>Hi guys,
>
>Usually when I build my TestSuite, I do something akin to
>
> TestSuite suite= new TestSuite("All JUnit Tests");
> suite.addTest(com.foo1.AllTests.suite());
> suite.addTest(com.foo2.AllTests.suite());
>
>then I run the testrunner.
>
>This works fine because I only have two packages I'm testing here.
>But every package I add, that means I'd have to add an AllTests class
>for that package, then make sure that new AllTests class takes care of
>it's subordinate classes and packages as well.
>
>This is slightly mechanical and painstaking *every* time I make a new
>package or class.
>
>Is there a more automated way JUnit can traverse through a package
>tree, and find all the classes that implement suite(), and
>automatically call them for me?
>
>Thanks!
>
>
